revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: "The twentieth year of the Emperor Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius, the 29th of the month of Hadrian. The elder Didymarion paid to Heron and his associates in collecting taxes the garden taxes for the eighteenth year , for the vineyard tax 1125 dr., for the naubion tax 60 dr., for surcharges 240 dr., for the eparourion tax 780 dr., for surcharges 60 dr., for the exchange tax 40 dr., for the receipt tax 6 chalkoi, for the eight-drachma Dionysos libation tax 8 silver drachmas.: total 8 dr., for the surcharges 3 1/2 ob., for the receipt ta 1 1/2 ob. For the survey tax for the nineteenth year 9 silver dr. 2 ob. 2 ch.: total 9 dr. 2 ob. 2 ch., for the surcharges 3 1/2 ob., for the receipt tax 1 1/2 ob. For the garden taxes for the twentieth year, for the vineyard tax 235 235 dr., for the naubion tax 15 dr., for surcharges 60 dr., for the eparourion tax 190 dr., for the surcharges 15 dr., for the exchange tax 10 dr., for the receipt tax 6 ch., for the eight-drachma Dionysos libation tax 2 silver dr.: total 2 dr., for surcharges 1/2 ob., for the exchange tax 1 1/2 ob."

listBibl.bibl: Gignac FT, BASP 16, 193-5, 1979 -- SB XVI 12325 Shelton JC, ZPE 39, 183-4, 1980
